favourite.article: This is a song I loved since childhood because my late mother sangs it passionately. It can heal all diseases and changes all situation. I dedicate it to my country Nigeria.
The song as the organ is played lifts me up unto His presence.

This hymn just came to me. I looked it up and found your site. Thanks for playing the song too. It makes me very emotional and I can't seem to understand why! Maybe I long to go the upward way and be healed completely and free from it all! Amen.

As I was meditating this night, some wordings of the chorus of this song came to me and this is a song I used to sing in the seventies. As I typed in the few words I remembered, behold every verse came out including the tune. Thank God for Internet but above all, thank God for such songs that still carry the meaning and anointing as ever. I was blessed.
I heard Joni Erickson Tata singing this song on the radio this morning and it was just what I needed to hear to start my day. God is good!

This song just came to me. I couldn't remember the words but I found it. And singing it in my heart calmed the storm within me for just awhile. Reading the comments helped me to breathe better. God sends to what you need not what you want. I needed this song tonight and it did what I needed it to do.
This song lifts my Spirit. Helps me press on and know that God takes people to higher levels. In Swahili .... " Ewe Bwana uniinue kwa Imani nisimame nipande milima yote......"

I was thought this song in 1983 as a chorister at St Peter' Ang. Church Umuozu. We had to learn the toning sofa cos there was no organ accompanying. It has remained with me ever since and I use it for inspiration. s s d m. m r d la. r d la s d m d r....s s d m m r d la r d la s d m r d. Refrain S d m s. S fa m fa...........

Thank you for your ministry through providing these lyrics. I've just finished reading Philippians 3:12-17, and was prompted to sing this song. My country is also at political crossroads as we prepare for the next general elections in 2017. Keep us in your prayers!
I went to bed last night with concerns for our nation. This morning I awakened with the lyrics to this song ringing in my heart. Our Father is still alive in America. God bless America.
My country is at the cross road now and I'm really confused about the situations, suddenly I remember this song. I know God will not forsake His people.
LORD forgive me
Thank you, praying and reading Matt.9:27. This song came to me. As I was praying. Thank you, Bless you, Bless the Living Lord.

This hymn was played/sung by our music director this morning, immediately following an altar call by the pastor, including a call to saints who wanted to profess dedication and obedience. I had not sung it in decades, and the effect on me was electrifying. Some lyrics can never be substituted by those of newer songs; the words sound as fresh as if the Spirit had just dropped them in our hearts. THIS hymn is a perfect example of why The Church must continue to keep some old hymns in its repertoire. As far as some old songs go, new writers/composers "can NOT say it better."
It's a high spirit song..... it really lifts my spirit each time I sing it.

This song takes me to another level every time I sing it. It gives me courage that God takes people from one level to another. Lets keep pressing on. May God bless you paapa for composing such a lovely song...
Great inspirational song. A lifter in valley experience days. God bless the composer of this wonderful song.
A lovely inspirational hymn taught me by my very vibrant Pastor Triumph Abatan in LFC Rumurolu Port Harcourt. God bless him. The hymn inspires me to another level of worship....
May glory be given to God by our looking steadfast for His coming as we bless those He puts in our path this day and every day until we see Jesus!

I attended Baptist High School. SAKI. Oyo State. Nigeria. Our principal Dr S. O. Ogundiran so much like it and for the students to be singing during morning devotion. It is one of my favourite hymns because the wordings have aspired me much in life now. Gloria Semper Deo (Glory Be to God).
I was singing the hymn in my heart, but wanted to sing it out but couldn't do it word for word... Thank God I got here and I know am already blessed. Praise God Almighty.
Cannot stop singing this song keeps coming up in my head reminds me of days when I was a pathfinder. Praise God....Amen.
My Favorite Hymn.
Glorious hymn...found it so timely.
This hymn is my favorite and I love it so much.
God certainly want us to live life at a higher level than we often find ourselves living in. May His grace help us to enter the Higher grounds in Jesus name.
This hymm brings joy to my heart.
This hymn always brings tears to my eyes in awe of my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.
This hymn blessed my soul this morning. Glory be to God.
I love this hymn too much. It keeps me pressing on in life no matter the problems that comes my way.

Oh my God, My Godmother just sang this song at church today... And when I tell you that she have tore the house up, she did... Then she ask our pastor to join in... That was even better... I Love Good Old Church Hymns... Just my kind of music! #PraiseGod
This hymn also inspires me and lift my soul up.
Nice Write up..... My best HYMN ever.
A truly inspirational song...to God be the glory.
This hymn reminds me of my mum. Whenever I think of it I hear and see her singing it. Lord, You are inspirational!
Very lovely for divine progress.
This hymn blesses my soul.
There's something unique about this hymn that lift my spirit and takes me to another level of worship. May God bless the composer.
This song is so, so inspiring.... Lord pls plant my feet on higher ground.
Am always inspired by the Holy Spirit with this song whenever am down, this song encourages me and gives me more hope... Lord plant my feet on higher ground.
What an inspired countenance, to live above the world, to catch a glims of glory bright! hallelujah, God in His Mercy has done all for us without reservation, blessed be His name forever, Amen.

That point when you don't really have the right words to express your hunger and the Holy Spirit drops a song in your spirit that aptly echoes your heart's cry. Lord Plant my feet on higher ground. That place of firmness. Where life is lived for a higher purpose - to turn men to God's light. Been over a decade I sang those words.
I bless God for the person who composed this high inspired song. This is what I pray in this our month of independence and victory.
A higher plane is what I pray 🙏 for everyday in You Jesus Christ.

Was thinking about my life and everything that was and the things that are to come and this song popped into my head. I am now comforted that He sees and knows my desires and will always see me through.

This song was poured into my spirit via the Holy spirit while l was praying. The Lord wants us to trust and depend on Him, not on mere man, who is here today and but gone tomorrow. Man will fail, but Jesus will never fail. To you listening to this awesome hymn be encouraged turn the words into a prayer point for elevation and decorating. You belong to the army of the Lord and not Satan. Whose mission is 3 fold: Kill, Steal and Destroy. I pray that you will aim for higher ground and leave the lower where Satan dwells. Re programme you mind for heavenly riches and to be a blessing. You will no longer slumber but you will arise and shine in the precious name of Jesus. Be encouraged and live a triumphant life until you are called for glory. Amen.

Lord plant my feet on higher ground. A higher ground than I have found in Jesus name. I cannot climb without my guide. Please my Jesus see me through this year 2015 and beyond in Jesus Name. Amen. With You I will succeed and I will not fail in Jesus Name. I will be fruitful, I will brake forth, no more sorrow, the joy of the Lord shall be my strength in Jesus Name. From henceforth, I will celebrate, I will jubilate, I will progress, I will be victorious in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!
Lord will lift us up to higher ground, and keep your faith in the name of Jesus. Be blessed.
Real inspiring and soul lifting song.
Simply inspiring!!!! Lord, always keep my feet on higher ground.
O Lord, Lead me on Higher Ground.
What an inspirational hymn with an intense domineering divine spirit. God will immensely reward the writer and bless the hearers in Jesus name, Amen.

Thanks to the almighty Holy Spirit that inspired the writer to compose this song. Thanks for uploading it with piano playing along as I sang it. I can't explain my feeling within. Jesus is Lord and King indeed. God bless you all richly.

This song is very inspirational, it always helps me to move in the right direction. It refreshes my mind all the time. I will not stop singing this song. I thank God for the composer of this nice song.

Lord plant my feet on higher ground. A higher ground than I have found in Jesus name. I cannot climb without my guide. Please my Jesus see me through this year 2015 and beyond in Jesus Name. Amen. With You I will succeed in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!
Glory to my God, indeed His's my Father.
A higher plane than I have found, this song actions us that God is above what we measure Him with, so we are fully convered as Christians, may God help us to serve Him in truth and sincerity Amen.
God revealed to me on January 1st 2015 that this will be my song for this year. He's indeed a great God...
Lord we are coming
Whenever I feel low, this hymn echoes in within me. It greatly inspires me.
What an inspiration hymn. Lord please don't let climb without my guide.
A few words are wrong. It's NOT "CANAANS TABLE" lol it's HEAVENS TABLE!!!!
Great work. How can I add Kana (Ogoni) version?
Lord lead me on.
This song motivates me!
So assuring that there is indeed a GOD who can make a way. LORD GOD plant our feet more in You. just love this song.
A beautiful prayer. God Bless!
It always refreshes my spirit.
This hymn refreshes the soul and spirit, giving health to the body.
This hymn is wonderful. God will surely plant our feet on higher ground in Jesus name. Amen.

My heart has no desire to stay in the slimy quicksand where doubts arise and fears dismay, leaving me double minded. I believe with all my heart that God is in control and has good plans for me. Doubt, fear and worry do not bring peace. They are Satan's darts. Praying for the rest to be found in CONSTANTLY looking to Jesus as He leads me on to higher ground.
This has been a theme song of mine for many years. It breathes reality -- doubts, darts, but above all, faith in the power of God to lift us up where we belong.

Lord plant my feet on higher ground. A higher ground than I have found in Jesus name. I cannot climb without my guide. Please my Jesus see me through this year 2015 in Jesus Name. Amen. With You I will succeed in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!
I want to scale the utmost height, Lord, lead me on to higher ground.

Something popped this song into my heart while I was meditating and asking for GOD'S Forgiveness. Don't know the words, but the piano made the best interpretation of the song. Dear LORD please help me in pressing on the upward way!
For the first time in my life I felt the power of the Holy Spirit. It was the day we sang this hymn in our church.

I love this song so much, I got up this morning and the song keeps ringing in my brain over and over again, Lord plant my feet on higher ground. May God bless all those who put the song together to make it a reality.
Lord lift me up!
I know this song from childhood. This morning before I got out of bed, this hymn came to me. Thanks for making it so readily a available—it made me feel better.
This is an unbelievable feat. God bless you.
This is a great adventure, Christian music on the net. How I wish I could do more... God bless the initiator and all the contributors to the success of this great vision. More grease to your elbow.
I am inspired!!!!
A motivational song for a week of prayer and fasting declared by Pastor Samuel Obuobi- PIWC, Kumasi.
This is one of the inspiring hymn that make me to work harder for God. I thank God for God's inspiration of the writer. God bless you all. Amen.
I really love this song.

Getting ready for work and my son tried to put my hymnal in my bag. I laughed and took it back out. Then at work this hymn came to mind. But I couldn't remember the words! Thanks for such a great resource.

This morning this song was sung to me in my dream. I kept on singing it till I woke up. Decided to look up the lyrics. This is amazing. God was definitely trying to tell me something. That no matter what I must continue to press on. The chorus kept on playing over and over. "Lord Plant my feet on higher ground" May the Lord plant our feet on higher ground. Amen.
It is my duty to press on. There will be doubts and fears. The enemy will hurl their darts. I have heights to scale. The LORD, my God, is the One that will take me to HIGHER GROUND.

Soul-inspiring hymn. Indeed, if we 'll keep pressing on by faith, trusting and obeying the Lord, irrespective of the darts Satan may be hurling at us, we 'll scale the utmost height and will not only catch a glimpse of glory bright but will ultimately be adorned with the white robe and together with the angels and the elders sing the worship song of Revelation 7:12. God help us in Jesus Name.

This song reminds me that we are on a sojourn on this earth and we have a home which is our destination. And every passing second of our life we are on a walk to that glory land. Ever day when we walk with the Lord we gain new height towards that Glorious home. Lord Jesus give me more grace to keep pressing on irrespective of the challenges that life may haul at me, I know if I press onto the end the Crown of glory sure await me on THAT DAY. Lord I bless Your name for this song.

Lord by Your power and grace maintain my steps firm in the path of life eternal. May heavenly and divine blessings come upon the lives of all who listen or sing or read this hymn we ask this through Christ our Lord.
Speaking to seniors/elderly about pressing toward the mark of a higher calling/higher ground. Not time to sit down, time to get down on the knees. Keep your eyes on the prize!
An ever fresh and a soul lifting hymn. This the theme of our Spoken-Word International Conference this year: Higher Ground
Wonderful, uplifting, pleasant memories, still a blessing.
This is awesome and soul lifting.
I am always uplifted whenever I sing this song. It has an inspiring energy to a weary soul.
Whenever I feel down in the dumps, or can't get energized to do work that should be done, I sing this song, and it feels as though He is right beside me, helping!
Lord grant me the grace to do thy will and to a fulfil life in Christ.
This songs always remind me that there is hope for the righteous and also inspired me when am down
Lord, indeed plant my feet on a high plane so that I might be able to stand against the evil one. Amen.
The Lord indeed will plant our feet on higher ground and forever He will back us up. Amen.
My heart is fixed Oh Lord, my heart is fixed. This hymn lifts my spirit.

This hymn gave me a message of hope. It is God alone that can take me to a higher ground. He is the solid rock of ages, a very present help in times of need, a glorious call to a higher ground. I am moving the upward ways, sky is my stepping stone. God is there for me, I am pressing forward daily, God will help and assist me in the race.
Simply inspirational. Always reminds me that there is always a new height to climb to no matter the level I am right now. Thank You, Jesus.
Inspires me to preach the word of God at higher frequency.
This song always uplift me when I am down.
This song brings me closer to the cross where Christ paid the ransom. I love my God. He promised me sunshine.
Am always moved by the wordings of this song and it gives me strenght to strive to qualify when Jesus comes. STRIVER SHOULD CONSIDER VERSE 3.

To research the word tableland, see BibleGateway.com. The word “tableland” is used in The Amplified Version, The English Standard, The English Standard Version Anglicised, Living Bible, The Message, The New Revised Standard Version, Anglicised, The New Revised Standard Version Anglicised Catholic Edition, The New Revised Standard Version Catholic Edition, The Revised Standard Version, The Revised Standard Version Catholic Edition.

It is one of those great hymns that reaches deep within and demands a higher level of commitment to the Lordship of Christ in our daily walk in this filthy world. It shakes the inner man to a level of discontent and inspires us to move forward in an upward path of growth in the Lord.
It's inspirational... God indeed is mighty and moves on men to do great works. God bless the composer with more knowledge and insights to do more to the Glory of God.
Such a powerful song. It draws me closer to God any time I listen.

This song takes me so close to heaven every time I concentrate on the Wordings! It is AWESOME! But I think the chorus line 2 is 'By Faith on heaven's Stable land or Canaan's Stable land and not 'Table land' at all!
I love this song. It uplifts my soul.
Jesus is King!

The anointing of the composition is what moves this song. God's glory comes down when the song is raised. It is a song of hope for me. God bless the generation of the composer and the saints all over the world.

This song is a masterpiece ever fresh to inspire, revive, renew my commitment to the Lord Jesus Christ and strengthen me in my walk with God. It gives me hope of eternal rest, reward on the last day when the race is over. Praise God. Amen.

This is one of many other spiritual songs that can take you straight into the presence of God and away from this world and its troubles.
God bless the composer real good.
A lifting up song. I love it.

There is no doubt that the composer of the song sought and obtained the anointing of God. The anointing of God is on this wonderful song - the various testimonies are evidences! All Christians, especially ministers of God, must always seek the face of God through prayers, fasting and meditation before any presentation or ministration. When we do this, our ministrations shall cause dry bones to rise again, sinners shall be convicted and saved, backsliders restored, the oppressed delivered, the sick healed, our land (and Church) revived and righteousness shall reign. So shall it be, in Jesus' name. (Amen)
Blessed be the composer. This is doing dumbfoundingly great good to me!

This hymn has encouraged me so much, especially when I want to minister the word of God to people. Some times the devil wants to instil fear in me, this song will lift me to a state of fearlessness. Thank God for the composer.

In spite of all I may be passing through, this song always gives me a lot of courage to move on in my pilgrim's journey. It's so inspiring. My prayer is that God will indeed plant my feet on higher ground in this planet earth, then in heaven not only to catch the gleam of glory but to also dwell in there for ever and ever with my Lord Jesus. Amen

As l listen to this beautiful piece of music, it brings me back to the days when I used to worship in the little country church in the island of Jamaica. Oh this wonderful hymn was a blessing then and is still blessing me. Thank God for the writer who was inspired by the Holy Spirit to bless so many thousands of people over the years.
Lord, plant my feet on Higher Ground. My special song.
What does "by faith on Canaan's tableland" mean?
I dedicated the hymn to God Almighty and to my first new born baby girl.
I like this song.
I like this song, Wonderful song.

My heart has no desire to stay Where doubts arise and fears dismay; Though some may dwell where these abound, My prayer, my aim, is higher ground.
Amen!
A good way for me to end my day and be at rest as I lay me down to Sleep, knowing HE has me & mine sorted out on Higher Ground as I wake up in the morning.
Awesome God!!!

I had a minor setback yesterday in an area in which God has been dealing with me. I went to sleep a bit discouraged, but awakened with this wonderful hymn in my spirit. It encouraged me to "press on to higher ground."

I so much love this hymn, especially the 2nd verse: "My heart has no desire to stay where doubts arise and fears dismay. Though some may dwell where these abound, my prayer, my aim, is higher ground". Amen.
My best hymn. Composed in 1898 by Johnson Oatman Jr., though in the past, yet radiantly aspire to the future.
Love this song...
What a beautiful prayer for all of God's people. May we continue to seek Him with a humble but expectant heart. What a glorious God we serve. There is no other!
That's so fantastic. Then let us press towards the mark of the prize of the high calling.
I woke up with this song on my lips. Thank You Lord because I know that what You have in store for me will surpass my imaginations.
This is my daily prayer. What else can a child of God wish for.
This song is based on faith. The assurance of what God has in store for me.
A hymn that daily uplift my spirit. It's a driving force for me. God bless the writer.
A song that gives me courage and hope, that soonest I will be place on higher ground.
This song reminds me of going on to another experience in God—entire sanctification.
it makes me to remember that God is always with me
An awe inspiring hymn...it sparks a flame within my soul.
I am so so blessed with the hymn. GOD BLESS.
I like this song. Asking God to plant you in His vineyard.
Wonderful song. Love the second verse especially. We sang this at church this Sunday.
The words of this song sums up every desire in my heart. I feel so encouraged when I sing and meditate on the words. God bless the people who put these together.
Higher ground in Jesus name.

What a melody to sooth our sorrows. I heard this song for the first at Deeper Life Easter retreat some 13 years ago and I was so touch by the words in the song, especially "My heart has no desire to stay where doubt arise and fear dismay". It's really touching and I always listen to it.
This is a powerful prayer point. We should press forward in our daily work with the Lord.
This hymn has really blessed me very much.
Ageless and soothes the inner mind. Great lyric. Good to meditate every single line of this great hymn.

The first time I heard of this hymn, about 15 years ago, was when I attended an Annual Convention of the Deeper Life Church at Brofoyedu in Ashanti Region. Nothing in life mattered to me again except to wholeheartedly and prayerfully meditate on every single word of this hymn. Till now whenever I sing this hymn or hear it play, my heart is humbled and I yearn more for the higher ground. I thank You LORD JESUS that You came to save us. Amen.

My mum really loves this song and she always sings it to me when I was little till now, especially when things don't really seem right. Ever since, I now do really love this song and it also encourages me whenever I am down. Glory be to God.
Loving this song.

A beautiful hymn...which my dad aged 80 years, heard and sang during his childhood days. This site helped me to get him the tune which he had long forgotten.... me and my wife Beatrice got to learn and teach my daughter Cressida.
I thank God for a song as this. Some of us we go through so much and these are just the words we need to hear. Our God is Faithful!
"Pressing.. New heights..Gaining..Every day...Though some may... I want to scale the utmost height". These are the words that have touched me the most.

How deeply gratifying to find this inspiring and marvelously uplifting hymn on-line. Recently I have been trying to recall some of the words. HIGHER GROUND has been on my top list of favorites since childhood. Then at an early age at mid-week prayer services when sometimes the selection of a song was requested, I would suggest Higher Ground. How very moving it has been to note the comments of other striving Christians around the world; for we are "called to be saints" and we pray for one another; I am further reminded of the message in the song: "When we all get to heaven, what a day of rejoicing it will be; when we all see Jesus we'll sing and shout the victory."

This is one of my favorite hymn, This song is definitely a prayer for me that God will lift me up and make me stand in spite of all troubles that I am passing through! Usually we sing this sitting in my church but as for me i'm the first one to jump up with my hands in the air. Praise God!!!!

I get encouraged, my hunger deepens for the Lord every time I see the lyrics of this song hung up my bedside. Listening to it today has lifted me.
Glory be to God!
It balances my daily actions and consciousness to the fact I have a Mighty Helper.

This song brings down the face of God to me whenever I am singing it and encourages me of better things ahead. It really motivates me every day. it has even become my morning devotional song. After singing this in the morning it fills my heart with hopes and desires to know HIM more.
This hymn is very soul lifting and powerful. We are using it tonight in our Archdeaconry Youth Vigil themed: My Time to Go Forward.
This is what every Christian or Non-Christian need to hear. Great instrument, my heart is fill with joy as I'm listening to this awesome instrumental.

The songs were written for our sake, that we make know the true GOD, worship Him in spirit and in truth, that we may learn to adore Him and know the beauty of His love, mercy and kindness to us, I LOVE YOU LORD, GIVE ME THE GRACE TO PLEASE YOU ALWAYS......
I needed to hear it this morning.
Oh Lord , we must press on for the Lord!!!!!!!!!!

Our voice, our words, our actions - all must synchronize to invite the LORD to lift us up. Like a little child, who has had enough from playing with toys, let us throw up our hands to our Father above to lift us up from our normal ways of life into the heights of unknown experience. LORD LIFT ME UP
It's a beautiful song any day. The Lord's never changing - that's why I can't get weary of the lyrics.
This song reminds me about the men and women of faith that has gone away. It encourages me to continue on my journey.
This hymn was my wedding procession song and any time the song is sang it make me remember my covenant with my wife. Even when I am in bad mode it has the power to change my emission.

I need not to be told that everyday that God allows me to be alive is another opportunity for me to continue pressing on, the upward way...because as I press on, new height I gain, while praying as I onward bound, I trust that God will plant my feet on higher ground. This song is inspiring and it makes me come to terms with the fact that, it is God and Him alone will see me through in all me undertaking. I can't sing this less because my heart has no desire to continue to stay in this world where doubts arise and fears dismay; though there are those who may want dwell where these abound, but my prayer, my aim is the higher ground...Lord, in Your mercy, lead me on to higher ground. Amen.
This hymn reminds me of a great work ahead. Tell me that it's only by God's grace that we will live.
This hymn is a message of hope and encouragement to me.
This hymn blesses my soul. It's a prayer worded so well that when I sing it I feel the desire of my heart has been communicated to God, my Father in Heaven. I really feel blessed. Amen.

I can't stop playing this hymn over and over again, the lyrics, the tune and the piano background, it is all very uplifting when I feel down. I appreciate these terms: the upward way, new heights, Canaan's tableland (wow! a higher plane than I have ever found).
I feel highly inspired whenever I listen to this hymn. It is highly educating and motivating.

It's early in the morning I just found the song after a search. I sang the song last night in a dream for hours though I don't know the lyrics. At dawn, I couldn't sleep longer till I went to my computer. Its an inspiration and a blessing, a song perfectly sang.
This song just reminds me that in this world we don't just sail through, but through pressing on we reach our expectations. Where we fail to stand, He lifts us. What a Saviour we have.

This song is very inspiring, it soothes my heart especially these words "I want to scale the utmost height. And catch a gleam of glory bright; But still I'll pray till rest I've found, Lord, lead me on to higher ground." My determination is to trust God until He comes or calls me home.
i like this song. prase the Lord ....for this song ...
I loved this song: one of my favorite Christian songs. Above is higher than clouds, where my Lord and Head and Saviour found.

The second verse of this song is a prayer I believe we must all pray. The earnest expectation of creation awaits the manifestation of the sons of God. Enough of the sins, doubts and fears that has held us down. It's time for a walk with God on higher ground.
I love this song very much. I am very blessed every time I hear this song. Keep singing to our Lord and be occupied with Him till He comes!

This song came to me while I was cooking and I began to search for the words even though I knew it in my dialect. The song is so inspiring and comforting as it strenghens me on the rocky roads I am throding in this life.

In my devotions this morning, I asked the Lord for His message to my heart and life in my current afflictions. Then He graciously directed me to the beautiful hymn: "I'm Pressing on the upward way" in support of my sermon, titled: "The Faith of the woman with the issue of blood." In the Gospel record of Mat. 9:20-22; Mar. 5:25-34; and Luke 8:43-47. I am inspired and Blessed to read the testimonies from the Saints around the world. God Bless you all in the Name of Jesus!

Wonderful, encouraging hymn based on Philippians 3:14: "I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus" (KJV). I believe this hymn is more commonly known as 'Higher Ground'. Praise Jesus!

I am considering using this song at a going away meeting for a sister who has been here serving 10 yrs in our locality and is moving on to another locality. I hope this song would encourage her as she moves to higher ground.

Hello I am from Hamilton also! Are you in the Lord's recovery? He is so rich and so full . This hymn gives me the assurance that I am on higher ground where the enemy and the world cannot touch me. Praise the Lord!

This song is my inspiration. I go to sleep and wake up with this song on my lips and in my heart. It inspires me to move on through hard times. I don't know what it does to others but it helps me go through life believing that there is a higher ground that I belong on and that one day I will surely be there. I cry whenever, I sing this song because it means a lot more to me than just a hymn.

I like this song because it uplifts my spirit. Everytime I feel sad and lonely I play it over and over until I sometimes cry tears of joy. My heart just bubbles over when I listen to it and I feel as if I am talking to the Lord and He is hearing me. It is my "picker upper".

I praise God for the message of this song. It has always been very personal to me. Every time I'm down this has always been the song of my heart. This is my prayer. This song never fades. It never runs obsolete. May this song forever minister to those who are at the lowest times of their lives, including myself...

Praise Him for this wonderful hymn, attending the blending conference in Israel was a wonderful experience for me, I love the Lord and his Body. After touring the Mount Of Olives we went back on the tour bus and sang this hymn...Oh Lord I felt truly lifted from this darkened age and realized how much the Body means to me and how He chose me before the foundation of this world to be a member of His unique Body. May the Lord continue to work Himself into me, lift me up to a higher ground.
On the way to work, I listen this wonderful hymn. It recalls my memories that God has led me through. He still faithfully leads me.

The words to this hymn came into my mind this morning as I came before God. I lost my 43 year old husband 8 weeks ago, suddenly. We have 5 children ages 11 -18. God has been faithfully holding me through this terrible devastation, and the grief I am experiencing. He is teaching me that this life we live on earth is not about smoothness and ease, it is about becoming totally reliant on Him...that it is the spiritual life that is important, and the physical one, which seeks to be comfortable is secondary. A smooth and comfortable life is not a good life...there is no need for God, there is no growth in Him. It was the words "a higher plane..." that came to my mind, He wants us to live above the turmoil or pleasure we are experiencing here on earth right now, and to live spiritually in total reliance on Him...the One who knows the end from the beginning, the One who is all-wise and knows what is best for us (even though we can't see it sometimes). He won't relent until He has it all... God bless you, whoever you are reading this, may you experience life on 'a higher plane' today.
This is one thing we must all desire everyday. Higher Ground. That is the plan of God for us all. I pray that we will go up higher everyday of our life according to God's divine plan for us.
I am trusting God to heal me and take me to a higher ground.
It is so uplifting song. Let the Lord bless us with this song.

This morning the Holy Spirit has been playing this tune to me. Jesus calls us all to higher ground; a place where God is, a place where the enemy is overpowered by the presence of Jesus. It is the place of victory. Our calling is to serve others from this higher ground showing the world a better place to live.

This song is so inspiring; it's filling. as I sang it in the church on Sunday, there was this inner peace and joy. The joy to move on further and the strength within came and I knew it was God and the Holy Spirit living in me. I am excited to move to the next level on Higher Ground.
On "a HIGHER plane than I have found"...until maturity!
The rhythm and the lyric are complementary with each other. They fit perfectly.

At a recent conference, we sang this song a lot and I was somewhat troubled by the words: "New heights I'm gaining every day..." I asked myself, is this true of me? Am I pressing on EVERY day? Lately, though, I have been practicing to pray each morning, "Lord, lead me on to higher ground today." Surely, this is a prayer that will be answered! I don't need to take responsibility for placing myself on higher ground. In fact, I can do nothing of myself that will bring me to higher ground. But, how I love my Good Shepherd! I just want to rest in Him as day by day He leads me into Himself!

To be in the spirit is the key, the secret. In the spirit we will experience many wonderful things of Christ because we have crossed the Jordan and entered into Canaan. When we are in the spirit, we are in the rest, and we are in the Holy of Holies. Therefore, we must always renounce the natural man, the outer man. For example, many times in the Lord's work I was tempted by the enemy to quarrel with others. On those occasions I felt that my reason was right, that the case was mine, and that I had the doctrine to support me. Yet while I was trying to speak, something deep within restricted me and stopped me. In order to go along with that deep feeling, I had to drop my quarreling. Consequently, it seemed that I had nothing to say. But I can testify that every time I went along with the spirit, there was victory. If we take care of our spirit, the mighty One in our spirit will be our strength. We will be transcendent and victorious over many things. When we come to the meetings, we will come with many items of Christ to contribute, either in prayer, singing, giving a testimony, or speaking a short word. Philippians 4:13 says, "I am able to do all things in Him who empowers me." But where does Christ empower us? He empowers us in our spirit. Our mind is the stronghold and the open gate for the enemy, but our spirit is the base for the Lord to do His work. Thus, when we go along with the mind, we are defeated, even though we may be doing something good. But if we go along with the spirit, we will be victorious. We will be on a high mountain, on higher ground, and, in the words of a hymn, "on Canaan's tableland" (Hymns, #396). We will be in the heavens and will be transcendent.
Source: Experiencing Christ in Our Spirit for the Church Life, chapter 4.
